result.markdown:
--- title: "Part 3 – Filename Conventions and Formats" --- The full and simple filename conventions specified here (Table 3.1) are strongly recommended but not mandatory. These conventions provide a consistent format for encoding key metadata into filenames, supporting traceability, metadata parsing, and long-term interoperability. Each filename follows a defined format, built from metadata-coded segments with standardized prefixes (see Table 3.2). These segments correspond to required metadata fields and are designed for reliable parsing, regardless of segment order. The spectrometer software will automatically append a measurement index (`IDX`) to the end of each filename—no additional text should be added after the `IDX`. Filename formats differ slightly depending on the type of target material (i.e., `targetClass`; see Table 4.5). For white and black-background targets, the `projectId (PI)` and `sessionId (SI)` are key segments for traceability and the `SI` is also critical for linking to all associated tissue measurements via the tissue full filename. For tissues, the full filename convention also includes the minimum session-level, specimen-level, and tissue-level metadata needed for confident data aggregation. A simplified filename convention may be used during measurement sessions to streamline data collection. However, projects should convert all filenames to the full format before archiving or sharing. When using the simplified format for local files, projects should maintain consistent file organization and take precautions to prevent ambiguity. --- ## Recommended Filename Conventions #### Table 3.1: Recommended Full and Simple Filename Conventions for Target Types. ::: {#c8b6d5a7 .cell results='asis' execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Target type (targetClass) Filename convention type Filename format Example
White target (TCW) Full PI<projectId>_SN<sessionId>_TC<targetClass>_<IDX> PIERYspec1_SN202406180932_TCW_0001
Black-background target (TCB) Full PI<projectId>_SN<sessionId>_TC<targetClass>_<IDX> PIERYspec1_SN202406180932_TCB_0001
White calibrated reflectance standard (TCWC) Full PI<project>_SN<session>_TC<target><serialNumber>_<IDX> PIFagaceae_SN202506171532_TCWC7254_0000
Black calibrated reflectance standard (TCBC) Full PI<project>_SN<session>_TC<target><serialNumber>_<IDX> PIFagaceae_SN202506171532_TCBC7210_0000
Tissue target on black background (BGB + TCAD/TCAB) Full PI<projectId>_SN<sessionId>_BG<backgroundClass>_HC<herbariumCode>_SI<specimenId>_TC<targetClass>_TN<targetTissueId>_<IDX> PIERYspec1_SN202406180932_BGB_HCGH_SI02022418_TCAD_TN1_001
Tissue target on black background (BGB + TCAD/TCAB) Simple SI<specimenId>_TC<targetClass>_TN<targetTissueId>_<IDX> SI02022418_TCAD_TN1_0001
Tissue target on paper (BGP + TCAD/TCAB) Full PI<projectId>_SN<sessionId>_BG<backgroundClass>_HC<herbariumCode>_SI<specimenId>_TC<targetClass>_TN<targetTissueId>_<IDX> PIERYspec1_SN202406180932_BGP_HCNEBC_SI00746092_TCAD_TN1_001
Tissue target on paper (BGP + TCAD/TCAB) Simple SI<specimenId>_TC<targetClass>_TN<targetTissueId>_<IDX> SI00746092_TCAD_TN1_0001
Paper target (BGB + TCP) Full PI<projectId>_SN<sessionId>_BG<backgroundClass>_HC<herbariumCode>_SI<specimenId>_TC<targetClass>_TN<targetTissueId>_<IDX> PIERYspec1_SN202406180932_BGB_HCNEBC_SI00746092_TCP_TN1_001
Paper target (BGB + TCP) Simple SI<specimenId>_TC<targetClass>_TN<targetTissueId>_<IDX> SI00746092_TCP_TN1_0001
``` ::: :::
### Table 3.1. Recommended Full and Simple Filename Conventions for Target Types | Target type (targetClass) | Convention Type | Filename format and example | |---------------------------|-----------------|-----------------------------| | White target (TCW) | Full | `PI_SN_TC_`
Example: `PIERYspec1_SN202406180932_TCW_0001` | | Black background target (TCB) | Full | `PI_SN_TC_`
Example: `PIERYspec1_SN202406180932_TCB_0001` | | White calibrated reflectance standard (TCWC) | Full | `PI_SN_TC_`
Example: `PIFagaceae_SN202506171532_TCWC7254_0000` | | Black calibrated reflectance standard (TCBC) | Full | `PI_SN_TC_`
Example: `PIFagaceae_SN202506171532_TCBC7210_0000` | | Tissue target on black background (BGB + TCAD/TCAB) | Full | `PI_SN_BG_HC_SI_TC_TN_`
Example: `PIERYspec1_SN202406180932_BGB_HCGH_SI02022418_TCAD_TN1_001` | | Tissue target on black background (BGB + TCAD/TCAB) | Simple | `SI_TC_TN_`
Example: `SI02022418_TCAD_TN1_0001` | | Tissue target on paper (BGP + TCAD/TCAB) | Full | `PI_SN_BG_HC_SI_TC_TN_`
Example: `PIERYspec1_SN202406180932_BGP_HCNEBC_SI00746092_TCAD_TN1_001` | | Tissue target on paper (BGP + TCAD/TCAB) | Simple | `SI_TC_TN_`
Example: `SI00746092_TCAD_TN1_0001` | | Paper target (BGB + TCP) | Full | `PI_SN_BG_HC_SI_TC_TN_`
Example: `PIERYspec1_SN202406180932_BGB_HCNEBC_SI00746092_TCP_TN1_001` | | Paper target (BGB + TCP) | Simple | `SI_TC_TN_`
Example: `SI00746092_TCP_TN1_0001` |
--- ## Filename Components Table 3.2 defines the components of filenames and their direct links to metadata fields. Each segment of the filename follows a specific format, with a standardized prefix that links directly to a required metadata field (see [Part 4](part4-metadata.qmd). These components form the structured conventions shown in Table 3.1 and enable automatic parsing and alignment between spectral files and metadata records. #### Table 3.2: Filename Components and Corresponding Metadata Fields. ::: {#1e2450c5 .cell results='asis' execution_count=2} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Target type (targetClass) Filename convention type Filename format Example
White target (TCW) Full PI<projectId>_SN<sessionId>_TC<targetClass>_<IDX> PIERYspec1_SN202406180932_TCW_0001
Black-background target (TCB) Full PI<projectId>_SN<sessionId>_TC<targetClass>_<IDX> PIERYspec1_SN202406180932_TCB_0001
White calibrated reflectance standard (TCWC) Full PI<project>_SN<session>_TC<target><serialNumber>_<IDX> PIFagaceae_SN202506171532_TCWC7254_0000
Black calibrated reflectance standard (TCBC) Full PI<project>_SN<session>_TC<target><serialNumber>_<IDX> PIFagaceae_SN202506171532_TCBC7210_0000
Tissue target on black background (BGB + TCAD/TCAB) Full PI<projectId>_SN<sessionId>_BG<backgroundClass>_HC<herbariumCode>_SI<specimenId>_TC<targetClass>_TN<targetTissueId>_<IDX> PIERYspec1_SN202406180932_BGB_HCGH_SI02022418_TCAD_TN1_001
Tissue target on black background (BGB + TCAD/TCAB) Simple SI<specimenId>_TC<targetClass>_TN<targetTissueId>_<IDX> SI02022418_TCAD_TN1_0001
Tissue target on paper (BGP + TCAD/TCAB) Full PI<projectId>_SN<sessionId>_BG<backgroundClass>_HC<herbariumCode>_SI<specimenId>_TC<targetClass>_TN<targetTissueId>_<IDX> PIERYspec1_SN202406180932_BGP_HCNEBC_SI00746092_TCAD_TN1_001
Tissue target on paper (BGP + TCAD/TCAB) Simple SI<specimenId>_TC<targetClass>_TN<targetTissueId>_<IDX> SI00746092_TCAD_TN1_0001
Paper target (BGB + TCP) Full PI<projectId>_SN<sessionId>_BG<backgroundClass>_HC<herbariumCode>_SI<specimenId>_TC<targetClass>_TN<targetTissueId>_<IDX> PIERYspec1_SN202406180932_BGB_HCNEBC_SI00746092_TCP_TN1_001
Paper target (BGB + TCP) Simple SI<specimenId>_TC<targetClass>_TN<targetTissueId>_<IDX> SI00746092_TCP_TN1_0001
``` ::: :::
### Table 3.2. Filename Components and Corresponding Metadata Fields | Code | Metadata field | Description | Example | |------|----------------|-------------|---------| | PI | projectId | Unique identifier for the spectral measurement project. | `PIHUHcoca`, `PIFagales1` | | SN | sessionId | A unique identifier generated from date/time when the session begins (`SNYYYYMMDDHHMM`). | `SN202406180932` | | BG | backgroundClass | Enumerated code from Background Class Codes (Table 4.7). | `BGB`, `BGP`, `BGO` | | HC | herbariumCode | Herbarium acronym or collection identifier. | `HCGH`, `HCINPA` | | SI | specimenId | Specimen ID (GUID, barcode, accession no., collector name + number). | `SI03774853`, `SIThorne24070` | | TC | targetClass | Enumerated code from Target Class Codes (Table 4.5). | `TCAD`, `TCAB`, `TCW`, `TCP`, `TCB` | | TN | targetTissueId | Index tracking measured tissue units (e.g., 1, 2, …). | `TN1`, `TN2` | | IDX | measurementIndex | Auto-appended by spectrometer software. | `0001`, `0002` |
